data.prayer: Lord, help the people of Benghazi, Libya to discover the essence of being a disciple, making disciples, and how to plant churches that multiply.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Benghazi, Libya
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Father, reveal yourself to a faithful non-believer today, someone like Cornelius, and then Father please connect him with the church in Benghazi, Libya.
data.verse: Cornelius answered: “Three days ago I was in my house praying at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly a man in shining clothes stood before me and said, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayer and remembered your gifts to the poor."

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 631 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, thank you that you will never abandon the church of Benghazi, Libya.
data.verse: Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said, “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.

data.prayer: Jesus, raise up prophets and truth speakers in your church in Benghazi, Libya so that the church can grow in every way into the mature body of you its head.
data.verse: Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will grow to become in every respect the mature body of him who is the head, that is, Christ.

data.prayer: Father, I pray that the Bedouin, Riyah  people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Bedouin, Riyah  people know you.
Father, set on fire the hearts and passion of your church in the state of Benghazi.
data.verse: Do not be slothful in zeal, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord.

data.prayer: Jesus, you said you were the giver of evangelists to the church. Please, send more evangelists to the state of Benghazi, Libya.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Lord, let it be said of the 561,210 lost in Benghazi that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light
